alert.note: Alert for Orange; Osceola (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 3:19PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong cluster of thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Orange and northwestern Osceola Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 318 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong cluster of thunderstorm over Hunters Creek, or near Buena Ventura Lakes, moving west at 10 mph. Strong boundary collisions along with cells merging were occurring with this cluster. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Orlando, Kissimmee, Bay Lake, Celebration and Buena Ventura Lakes. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
